metadata.copyright_compliance: Original content based on general medical knowledge

content.title: Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD
content.statement: Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Pad that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD.

infrarenal_aorta.disease_pattern: Calcified, often with coral reef appearance

common_iliac.location: Aortic bifurcation to internal/external iliac bifurcation

external_iliac.location: Internal iliac bifurcation to inguinal ligament

leriche_syndrome.internal_iliac_importance: Preserved internal iliacs improve sexual function

type_a.lesion: Unilateral or bilateral CIA stenosis; unilateral or bilateral short EIA stenosis

type_b.lesion: Short infrarenal aortic stenosis; unilateral CIA occlusion; single or multiple EIA lesions

type_c.lesion: Bilateral CIA occlusions; bilateral EIA stenoses; unilateral EIA stenosis extending to CFA

type_d.lesion: Infrarenal aortic occlusion; diffuse disease involving aorta and both iliacs; iliac occlusions extending to CFA

endovascular.access: Retrograde femoral, brachial/radial for flush occlusions

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

definition.@value: Atherosclerotic occlusive disease of the aorta and iliac arteries requiring treatment before addressing outflow lesions.

diagnosis: ABI (may be falsely elevated if calcified)
CTA or MRA for anatomic planning

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Inflow Disease Patterns in PAD. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the anatomic segments of inflow disease
Apply TASC II classification to guide treatment selection
Explain the principle of 'inflow before outflow'
Select appropriate endovascular vs open treatment
clinical_pearls: Check femoral pulse - if weak/absent, suspect inflow disease
Leriche triad: claudication, impotence, absent femoral pulses
TASC A/B = endovascular; TASC D = traditionally open
Preserve internal iliacs for pelvic perfusion and sexual function

medicalCode.name: Atherosclerosis of native arteries of extremities with intermittent claudication
